title: Quantized enveloping algebra
summary: In mathematics, a quantum or quantized enveloping algebra is a q-analog of a universal enveloping algebra.[1] Given a Lie algebra g {\displaystyle {\mathfrak {g}}} , the quantum enveloping algebra is typically denoted as U q ( g ) {\displaystyle U_{q}({\mathfrak {g}})} . The notation was introduced by Drinfeld and independently by Jimbo.[2]
